etymology.description: 太(太) (tài, "too; very") + 好(好) (hǎo, "good") + 了(了) (le, "particle indicating change or excitement")
etymology.interpretation: The phrase 太好了 (tài hǎo le) combines 太(太) (tài, "very") with 好(好) (hǎo, "good") to emphasize how excellent something is, reinforced by 了(了) (le) which expresses a sense of excitement or change. It is commonly used to express delight or approval.

examples.chinese: 今天的天气太好了(今天的天氣太好了)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān de tiānqì tài hǎo le.

examples.chinese: 听说你通过考试(聽說你通過考試)，太好了(太好了)。
examples.pinyin: Tīngshuō nǐ tōngguò kǎoshì，tài hǎo le.
examples.english: I heard you passed the exam, fantastic!

examples.chinese: 能见到你真是太好了(能見到你真是太好了)。
examples.pinyin: Néng jiàn dào nǐ zhēn shì tài hǎo le.
examples.english: It is truly fantastic to see you.
